conclusion: To find the electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square, calculate contributions from each charge and sum them up.
Identify the coordinates and distances: side length of the square is L, intersection of diagonals is the center, distance from center to any corner is L/sqrt(2).
Electric field due to a single charge is given by Coulomb's law: E = kq/r^2.
Calculate electric field at the center due to charges at A and B: E_A/B = 2kq/L^2.
Calculate electric field at the center due to charges at C and D: E_C/D = -2kq/L^2.
Direction of electric fields: positive charge points away, negative charge points towards.
Vector summation of electric fields: fields due to A and B point diagonally outward, fields due to C and D point diagonally inward.
Net electric field: contributions from each pair of opposite charges cancel out.
Total electric field at the center of the square is zero.
